reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Veterinary Diagnostic Quality Assurance Training. Veterinary Diagnostic Quality Assurance Training 2020

description.narrative: Support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade.

This award strives to support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade. In addition, this award The Veterinary Diagnostic Laboratory Quality Assurance (VDLQA) Symposium will be offered by the University of Delaware’s Avian Biosciences Center. The VDLQA symposium is an intensive five-day program held at the University's College of Agriculture and Natural Resources in Newark, Delaware. The program will cover an overview of Quality Assurance System requirements, the implementation and upkeep of a Quality Assurance System, records, document control, creating and revising standard operating procedures, corrective actions, audits and management reviews. Upon successful completion of the program, participants will receive a Certificate in Basic Laboratory Quality Assurance from the University of Delaware. Participants will also leave the program with examples of Quality Assurance Documents, which may serve as a template for the participants’ laboratory system. (This project was originally scheduled for 2020 and was rescheduled due to COVID 19.). Participants will also leave the program with examples of Quality Assurance Documents, which may serve as a template for the participants’ laboratory system..
